title: International Number System
description: Work with place values and numerals in the International system.

questions.question: What is the place value of 6 in 3,672,981 (International system)?
Write 2,508,109 in words (International system).
options: Two million five hundred eight thousand one hundred nine
Two million fifty-eight thousand one hundred nine
Two million five hundred eight hundred nine
Two billion five hundred eight thousand one hundred nine
questions.explanation: Correct reading is: Two million five hundred eight thousand one hundred nine.

questions.question: How many zeros are there in one million?
questions.explanation: One million = 1,000,000, which contains six zeros.

questions.question: Write the numeral for “Four million seventy-three thousand four hundred twenty.”
Which period contains hundreds, tens, and ones in the International system?
questions.explanation: The ones period comprises hundreds, tens, and ones.

questions.question: What digit is in the ten-thousands place of 8,726,451?
questions.explanation: 2 is in the ten-thousands place in 8,726,451.

questions.question: What is the value of 9 in 9,345,012?
What is the predecessor of one million?
What is the smallest 7-digit number?
questions.explanation: 1,000,000 is the smallest number with seven digits.

questions.question: Which number is greater: 5,000,999 or 4,999,999?
questions.explanation: 5,000,999 is greater because its millions digit (5) exceeds that of 4,999,999.
